qas.question: How many non-white people lived in New York in 1890?
What was the name of the Prohibition-era African-American cultural flourishing in New York?
What was the population of people in New York that were not Caucasian in 1890?

context: New York's non-white population was <a0_0><a2_0>36,620<a2_0/><a0_0/> in 1890. New York City was a prime destination in the early twentieth century for African Americans during the Great Migration from the American South, and by 1916, New York City was home to the largest urban African diaspora in North America. The <a1_0>Harlem Renaissance<a1_0/> of literary and cultural life flourished during the era of Prohibition. The larger economic boom generated construction of skyscrapers competing in height and creating an identifiable skyline.
